info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 3:01AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility and Slippery Surfaces... Fog has developed across portions of the Central and North Central Montana plains and is expected to persist through the late morning or early afternoon hours. Some areas may see locally dense fog, especially low-lying areas, which could reduce visibility to near one quarter of a mile. Additionally, with temperatures well below freezing, roads surfaces like bridges and overpasses may become slippery and hazardous. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing conditions over short distances. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra spacing between vehicles if driving through fog.
